ECUADOR üá™üá®
Eat the World NYC review:
Stickers for every team in Ecuadorian Serie A adorn the door as you walk in and Bronx Ecuadorians have a home to watch their favorite clubs from back home on their nation's broadcasting network. But the awning reads "bar" AND "restaurant," so explore the full menu if you get a chance. Cheap buckets of beer are just a quick order away, if you feel like lingering. Which you will.

I came for special event - ordered from the menu very late - my fritada was on point . Clean establishment. Lots of locals. Can accommodate large groups. Ethnic menu. Such a small world - bumped into an old friend... will return.

Encebollado de pescado ü§§ #bueno #bonito y #barato es el lema de nosotros los ecuatorianos üá™üá® üá™üá® excelente lugar para degustar nuestra t√≠pica comida de Ecuador. Se los recomiendo üòéüëçüèº‚Ä¶

Muy recomendado. La comida es deliciosa, sobretodo el seco de chivo, pero solo los fines de semana lo tienen. El due√±o del local es muy amigable. Tienen otras opciones de fin de semana como caldo de salchicha entre otros. Me queda un poco lejos en el Bronx porque vivo en Brooklyn, pero vale totalmente la pena.

My family and I love this place. They are so friendly and the food is amazing.
Yes it's not decorated and up to date, but I love those whole in the wall places.‚Ä¶
Me gusta la comida es deliciosa excelente la atencion y sobre el ceviche de pescado es el mejor..

This hidden little bar is honestly not that bad. It's not the most upscale bare to say the least but it gets the job done. There is some decent food sold and the employees are pretty alright. The patrons and music definitely add to the atmosphere. Nice Ecuadorian spot to try out

This place is very clean.  And food tastes amazing. And it‚Äôs not expensive. You don‚Äôt have to wait long for the food to be on your table, which is amazing . I wish I could live next to this restaurant so I could eat there everyday. Best Ecuadorian food near Fordham rd.

La comida es buena ... tiene el sazon ecuatoriano,  el encebollado de pescado buenisimo,... deben evitar que consuman cerveza mucho, ayer domingo fui con mi familia y el ambiente tipico como en Duran,.. full volumen musica de cantina y los gritos de los comensales,  terrible,  estuvimos a punto de irnos, pero las ganas de comer mi encebollado,  nos quedamos,... por favor mejoren ese ambiente de pueblo...

The food tasted great, my only complaint is that the ceviche was hot more like a soup (not sure if that's how it's served in Ecuador) which was a shock to my tastesbuds. The music was loud and no one approached us at the door to help us with seating. We were just standing there being ignored.. But again, the food was good

This is a nice spot. The only reason I gave it 4stars is because it‚Äôs menu is limited. However it‚Äôs a cozy small restaurant, good customer service (friendly) and the food is good. No regrets....it reminded me of my moms cooking.

Us not the luxury place but is a nice place.I ate with my husband, husband brother,his dad and my son . Comimos en familia y nos atendieron bien.La comida estaba rica
Amazing food!! The taste of everything here is authentic and delicious. Would definitely recommend this place for anyone looking for great Ecuadorian food.
As always food was great.  Only issue today is we should've called ahead to see if they had any chaulafan.  Was in the mood.

This place is very unique in taste and feel. There is a very small menu but it is tasty.
Tastes very authentic. If you want to try Ecuadorian food, give this place a try.

The food is fantastic and the service is the best.the waitresses really do there part .. The food is great.. This is the go to place for great food
